thread.title: Disney pairs up 'Star Wars' premiere, Hollywood Studios party
thread.title_full: Disney pairs up 'Star Wars' premiere, Hollywood Studios party

author: Dewayne Bevil
title: Disney pairs up 'Star Wars' premiere, Hollywood Studios party
text:
Disney pairs up 'Star Wars' premiere, Hollywood Studios party 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' official trailer #2 
Watch the new "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" trailer. The movie opens in theaters on December 18, 2015. 
Watch the new "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" trailer. The movie opens in theaters on December 18, 2015. Dewayne Bevil Contact Reporter Ticketholders will see new film at Disney Springs, fireworks at Studios 
Disney World is planning a two-pronged "Star Wars" celebration, teaming the debut of the upcoming film and a private party at Disney's Hollywood Studios theme park on Dec. 17. 
Ticketholders for the special event will watch "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" at the AMC Disney Springs 24 theater and then attend an after-hours party at Hollywood Studios until 2 a.m. The park event will include the new Star Wars Launch Bay exhibit, the Star Tours ride, a dance party and a preview of the fireworks show set to the "Star Wars" score. Folks will also get a souvenir ticket. 
Tickets will go on sale tonight after the latest trailer for "The Force Awakens" during halftime of the Monday Night Football game on ESPN. (Go to amctheatres.com/starwarswdw to buy.) Tickets for the event range between $94.99 and $99.99, depending on the format of film selected. 
Disney's Hollywood Studios eventually will be home to a land dedicated to the "Star Wars" franchise. The 14-acre area, announced in August, will be part of the park's makeover that also includes a "Toy Story" land. 
The fine print: Disney will not sell party-only tickets; participants must provide their own transportation between the theater and the party; at the theme park, some merchandise and food outlets will be open, but Disney does not plan to operate other non-"Star Wars" attractions that evening; and costumes are encouraged for the event -- with some safety restrictions.
